none: Northwestern vs. Northern Illinois and Northwestern vs. Indiana
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music (Contributor)
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music

Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1985 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against Northern Illinois Huskies at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Conducted by Dale Lonis, pregame performances include the National Anthem, "Wildcat Fantasy," and "Go U Northwestern." High school marching bands from the Illinois and Wisconsin area join the Northwestern University Marching Band on the field for a halftime performance that includes "Yankee Doodle Dandy," "You're a Grand Old Flag, " "Chimes of Liberty," and "God Bless America." John P. Paynter then conducts the bands for "Alma Mater." Postgame performances by the NU Marching Band include "Go U Northwestern," "Theme from Shaft," "Georgia On My Mind," and "Alma Mater." The second performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Indiana Hoosiers in Bloomington, Indiana. Pregame performances include the National Anthem and "Go U Northwestern." Pregame performance by the NU Marching Band include "Indiana Our Indiana," "Wildcat Fantasy," and "Go U Northwestern." The Indiana Marching Band performs "Indiana Our Indiana," "Go U Northwestern," and "Hail To Old IU." John P. Paynter then conducts the National Anthem.

The recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited. Please contact specialcollections@northwestern.edu for more information
Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections API
Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections

Digitization of this collection was funded by a generous gift from the family of Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, who began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging.
